hanzi-su-wiki:
喪

Значения

Траур; потеря

Мнемоника

Искажено. Выть 口, как собака 犬 по погибшему 亡 хозяину.

Варианты

丧
purpleculture_pinyin:
sāng
mourning; funeral; (old) corpse
траур; похороны; (старый) труп

sàng
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc); to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc); to die; disappointed; discouraged
потерять что-то абстрактное, но важное (смелость, авторитет, жизнь и т. д.); быть лишенным (своего супруга и т. д.); умереть; расстроен; обескураженный

heisig_chinese_memo: I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross at their funeral, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves as a symbol for my mother's love of hair styles and my father's support of it.
heisig_constituent: miss, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, hairpin, safety-pin, mouth2
heisig_story: Soil . . . two mouths . . . hairpin. Hint: see spit (Frame 162). The key word carries the wide range of meanings readily associated with it: error, loss, absence, and so on.
koohiiStory1: I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. "Soil" is not drawn in its stroke order.
koohiiStory2: This kanji means miss as in "miss a (dearly departed) person", not as in "miss a target".　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　Here the dearly departed has been buried in the ground, with her favourite hairpin in place of a gravestone, and two mourners stand around crying with open mouths.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Under the cross is a mouth and another mouth wearing special clothes because they're in mourning.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the cross looming overhead, people's mouths open so they can sob loudly, and everyone wearing the same color clothes (just picture whatever color works for your particular culture/religion combo).
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As the mourning continues, the soul (そう) of the dead person rises out of the cross. The soul looks around at all of the mourners and nods. Yes, your mourning has pleased it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you aren't mourning enough, when the soul comes out of the person's body, it will get really mad. "What, I'm not worth a few tears? Really?" And then the soul will haunt you. So you better mourn like you mean it.

sāng: (графема) похороны

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: On this soil was the funeral of a zoologist.  Her friends stuck some animal horns in the soil and buried her with her favorite hairpin.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions start from " sang " and count the " mouth ". " Sang " is the sound symbol. Yu Shengwu believes that the mouth is a tool used for picking mulberry. Silk fabrics existed in the Shang Dynasty, so this word oracle bone inscription is the original word for picking mulberry. Li Xiaoding thinks that the number of mouths means noise and noise. One said that ancient funeral tools were made with mulberry wood. Mulberry was a symbol of funerals. It was like many slogans crying (Yin Liyun).

The original meaning according to configuration word of mourning No satisfactory statement, inscriptions from " Sang " from the " dead " from the number of " mouth ", because " Sang " Kim Moon-shaped to have been falsely written deformed, plus a " dead " as Sound symbol, and " death " also means loss, loss, so that the meaning of the word " mourning " can be expressed. Bronze writing may add "to go " as a sign.

Bronze inscription means loss and perish, Mao Gongding: "You only lose me or (country)", Dayingding: "Yin (only) Yin Bian, Hou Tian (dian) 𩁹 (and) Yin Zheng, 100 Pirates are at your disposal ( Wine), the ancient (so) mourning 𠂤 (teacher) has been (矣)". It also means misfortune, Yu Ding: "Wu Yu is mournful! Use the sky to descend to the next or (country)." Also used as a name.

"Said Wen": "Mourning, death. From crying to death. Knowing. Death also sounds."
humanum_short_description_en: " mourning " A number of inscriptions from the " mouth ", " mulberry " sound, Jin added from the " dead " sound, " mourning ", " Sang " is a homonym, so the " funeral " by the word " Sang " words to express, In order to distinguish it from " Sang ", we add " mouth ".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「桑」從數「口」，「桑」是聲符，于省吾認為口乃採桑所用之器，商代已有絲織品，故此字甲骨文是採桑之本字。李孝定則認為數口表示喧嘩嗷嘈之意。一說古代喪器講究以桑木制作，桑是辦理喪事的象徵，其從多口正象眾口號啕大哭之形（尹黎雲）。

　　按喪字的構形初義未有滿意的說法，金文從「桑」從「亡」從數「口」，因為「桑」形至金文已訛寫變形，故另加「亡」為聲符，而「亡」又有喪失、亡失之意，使「喪」字字義得以彰顯。金文或增「走」為意符。

　　金文表示喪失、滅亡，毛公鼎：「迺唯是喪我或(國)」，大盂鼎：「隹(唯)殷邊侯田(甸)𩁹(與)殷正百辟率肆于酉(酒)，古(故)喪𠂤(師)已(矣)」。又表示禍殃，禹鼎：「烏虖哀哉﹗用天降大喪于下或(國)。」又用作人名。

　　《說文》：「喪，亾也。从哭从亾。會意。亾亦聲。」
humanum_short_description: 「喪」甲金文從數「口」，「桑」聲，金文加從「亡」聲，「喪」、「桑」同音，故「喪」字借「桑」字來表示，為了與「桑」區別，故加數「口」。

甲骨文從「 桑 」從數「 口 」，「 桑 」是聲符，于省吾認為口乃採桑所用之器，商代已有絲織品，故此字甲骨文是採桑之本字。李孝定則認為數口表示喧嘩嗷嘈之意。一說古代喪器講究以桑木制作，桑是辦理喪事的象徵，其從多口正象眾口號啕大哭之形（尹黎雲）。 按喪字的構形初義未有滿意的說法，金文從「 桑 」從「 亡 」從數「 口 」，因為「 桑 」形至金文已訛寫變形，故另加「 亡 」為聲符，而「 亡 」又有喪失、亡失之意，使「 喪 」字字義得以彰顯。金文或增「 走 」為意符。 金文表示喪失、滅亡，毛公鼎：「迺唯是喪我或(國)」，大盂鼎：「隹(唯)殷邊侯田(甸)𩁹(與)殷正百辟率肆于酉(酒)，古(故)喪𠂤(師)已(矣)」。又表示禍殃，禹鼎：「烏虖哀哉﹗用天降大喪于下或(國)。」又用作人名。 《說文》：「喪，亾也。从哭从亾。會意。亾亦聲。」
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions start from " sang" and count the " mouth". " Sang" is the sound symbol. Yu Shengwu believes that the mouth is a tool used for picking mulberry. Silk fabrics existed in the Shang Dynasty, so this word oracle bone inscription is the original word for picking mulberry. Li Xiaoding thinks that the number of mouths means noise and noise. One said that ancient funeral tools were made with mulberry wood. Mulberry was a symbol of funerals. It was like many slogans crying (Yin Liyun). The original meaning according to configuration word of mourning No satisfactory statement, inscriptions from " Sang" from the " dead" from the number of " mouth", because " Sang" Kim Moon-shaped to have been falsely written deformed, plus a " dead" as Sound symbol, and " death" also means loss, loss, so that the meaning of the word " mourning" can be expressed. Bronze writing may add "to go" as a sign. Bronze inscription means loss and perish, Mao Gongding: "You only lose me or (country)", Dayingding: "Yin (only) Yin Bian, Hou Tian (dian) 𩁹 (and) Yin Zheng, 100 Pirates are at your disposal ( Wine), the ancient (so) mourning 𠂤 (teacher) has been (矣)". It also means misfortune, Yu Ding: "Wu Yu is mournful! Use the sky to descend to the next or (country)." Also used as a name. "Said Wen": "Mourning, death. From crying to death. Knowing. Death also sounds."

喪字的基本解释

喪
sāng

喪
sàng
均见“丧”。

喪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sāng］
［《廣韻》息郎切，平唐，心。］
“丧1”的繁体字。
(1)哀葬死者的礼仪。
(2)泛指与人死亡有关的各种事情。参见“喪事”。
(3)人的尸体、骨殖。
(4)指祸难。
[②]［sàng］
［《廣韻》蘇浪切，去宕，心。］
“丧2”的繁体字。
(1)丧失；失去。
(2)人死。
(3)灭亡；失败。
(4)逃亡；流亡。
(5)消耗，耗费。
(6)忘记，忘掉。
(7)悲悼，忧伤。
(8)神态不满或不乐的样子。

喪字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　喪； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页200第12
〔古文〕?????【廣韻】【正韻】蘇浪切【集韻】【韻會】四浪切，?桑去聲。【玉篇】亡也。　又【正韻】失位也。【論語】二三子何患於喪乎。【註】喪，失位也。【左傳·昭二十四年】昭公曰：喪人不佞。　又【廣韻】息郞切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】蘇郎切，?音桑。【正韻】持服曰喪。【禮·檀弓】故孔氏之不喪出母，自子思始也。【又】子夏喪其子，而喪其明。【釋文】上喪字平聲，下喪字去聲。　又【廣韻】喪，器也，今謂之柩。【禮·曲禮】送喪不踰境。　又姓。【廣韻】楚大夫喪左。【說文】本作?。【廣韻】亦作?。

喪字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
喪字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sāng］
["Guangyun" Xilangqie, Ping Tang, Heart. ]
The traditional characters of "mour1".
(1) The etiquette of mourning the dead.
(2) Broadly refers to various things related to human death. See "funeral".
(3) Human corpses and bones.
(4) Refers to misfortune.
[②]［sàng］
["Guangyun" Su Lang cuts, go down, heart. ]
The traditional characters of "mour 2".
(1) Lost; lost.
(2) People die.
(3) Perish; fail.
(4) Escape; exile.
(5) Consumption, consumption.
(6) Forget, forget.
(7) Mourning, sadness.
(8) An expression of dissatisfaction or unhappiness.

[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　 mourning; Kangxi strokes: 12; page number: page 200 to 12
[Ancient text]????? [Guangyun] [Zhengyun] Su Langqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme] Four waves are cut, and the sound is gone. [Jade articles] Death too.　 [Zheng Yun] also lost position. [The Analects] Why do the two or three sons suffer from loss? [Note] Lost and out of position. [Zuo Zhuan·Twenty-fourth Year of Zhao] Zhao Gong said: To lose a person is not a ren.　[Guang Yun] Xi Yin Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Su Lang Qi,? Yin Sang. [Zheng Yun] Wearing clothes is called mourning. [Li·Tan Gong] Therefore, the Confucian family did not lose his mother, since his son thought about it. [Also] Zixia lost his son, and lost his Ming. 【Explanation】The upper mourning character has a flat sound, and the lower mourning character goes to sound.　[Guangyun] mourning, the instrument is also called the 柩 nowadays. 【Rite·Music Gift】The funeral will not go beyond the border.　Another last name. Name meaning

sàng, sāng
вм. 丧
Radicals: 十, 口, 衣  (cross, mouth, clothes)
Meaning Mnemonic
Under the cross is a mouth and another mouth wearing special clothes because they're in mourning.
Picture the cross looming overhead, people's mouths open so they can sob loudly, and everyone wearing the same color clothes (just picture whatever color works for your particular culture/religion combo).
Reading Mnemonic
As the mourning continues, the soul (そう) of the dead person rises out of the cross. The soul looks around at all of the mourners and nods. Yes, your mourning has pleased it.
If you aren't mourning enough, when the soul comes out of the person's body, it will get really mad. "What, I'm not worth a few tears? Really?" And then the soul will haunt you. So you better mourn like you mean it.

Examples: 喪 (も)
一 (один), ｜, 口 (рот), 衣 (одежда)
